channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Jamie Dimon says Trump’s presidential pressure on the Fed is nothing new—but impact is limited
item.description: JPMorgan CEO Jamie Dimon is unsurprised by President Trump's push for lower inflation and interest rates—but warns that doesn't mean the Oval Office c...

item.title: Ramadan in the West Bank: Displacement and Despair
item.description: An Israeli military operation has uprooted tens of thousands of Palestinians who can’t break their fast in their own homes and don’t know when, or if,...

item.title: Stocks Pare Losses After Trump’s Moves and Comments Rattled Investors
item.description: Investors were shaken by President Trump’s latest tariff threat, dragging the S&P 500 down further after its worst day of the year.

item.title: Separatists Hijack Train Carrying Over 400 Passengers in Pakistan
item.description: The authorities were struggling to reach the remote site of the ambush in the country’s southwest, and the passengers’ fate was not immediately known.

item.title: CEOs haven’t felt this pessimistic about American business conditions since spring 2020, when the deadly coronavirus sent everyone home from work
item.description: Just under half of the CEOs surveyed expected a recession or slowdown in the next six months.

item.title: Dubai Is a Vision of the Future
item.description: The city is dramatically rewriting the story of skilled migration.

item.title: Why the I.C.C. Arrested Duterte Despite Questions Over Jurisdiction
item.description: Rodrigo Duterte, the former president of the Philippines, was arrested on a warrant issued by the International Criminal Court. But questions of juris...

item.title: BlackRock CEO sounds the alarm to Trump on the scarcity of this skilled trade profession—but Gen Z may be able to save the day
item.description: The U.S. may soon run out of electricians thanks to data center demand and nationalist immigration policies, warns BlackRock CEO Larry Fink.

item.title: Tesla owners offloading their cars over Elon Musk backlash are in for a nasty surprise
item.description: A different kind of sticker shock.

item.title: Ukraine and U.S. Talks on War Begin as Gulfs Remain
item.description: American and Ukrainian representatives are meeting in Saudi Arabia, but the United States, Ukraine and Russia envisage very different paths to peace.

item.title: Tuberculosis Resurgent as Trump Funding Cut Disrupts Treatment Globally
item.description: The United States was the major funder of tuberculosis programs. Now hundreds of thousands of sick patients can’t find tests or drugs, and risk spread...

item.title: Separatists Hijack Train Carrying Over 400 Passengers in Pakistan
item.description: The authorities were struggling to reach the remote site of the ambush in the country’s southwest, and the passengers’ fate was not immediately known.

item.title: Ukraine and U.S. Talks on War Begin as Gulfs Remain
item.description: American and Ukrainian representatives are meeting in Saudi Arabia, but the United States, Ukraine and Russia envisage very different paths to peace.

item.title: Goldman Sachs’ chief economist just downgraded the entire U.S. economy as Trump’s latest tariff salvo rattles markets
item.description: The storied investment bank has forecast GDP growth to come in below Wall Street’s consensus for the first time in 2½ years.
